title: [K-12] Project-Based Learning to Strengthen Instructional Design Imagination Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational instructional design theory and experience in social studies education
context.additional_context: Learner-specific device utilization and performance of field-oriented social studies design tasks.

learning_goals: Learners can derive at least three instructional design strategies utilizing creative and reproductive imagination.
Learners can enhance instructional design imagination competency by over 20% through self-regulated motivation reinforcement.
Learners can develop an integrated instructional design model combining self-efficacy, generative cognition, and educational environment elements.
Learners can optimize the creative problem-solving process by applying negative emotion management strategies.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
